qas.question: What was able to rise from the death of the Near East?
What notable nation was able to rise from the ashes of the Near East?
How did the Republic of Turkey align themselves?
Who was the founder of the Republic of Turkey?
Who was a former Ottoman high-ranking officer?

context: From the death of the Near East <a0_0>new nations<a0_0/> were able to rise from the ashes, notably <a1_0>the Republic of Turkey<a1_0/>. Paradoxically it now aligned itself <a2_0>with the west<a2_0/> rather than with the east. <a3_0><a4_0>Mustafa Kemal<a4_0/><a3_0/>, its founder, a former Ottoman high-ranking officer, was insistent on this social revolution, which, among other changes, liberated women from the strait rules still in effect in most Arabic-speaking countries. The demise of the political Near East now left a gap where it had been, into which stepped the Middle East.
